channel.title: Free Domains. Using a real DNS server
channel.description:
this is sort of like Magmas DNS(this doesnt edit the hosts file), but it uses a real dns server. So you will need to go to control panel (this is the windows xp way.) Have it in windows xp style, classic is just too many icons to explain. Now click 'Network and Internet Connections' now go down the list and click 'Network Connections' Right click>properties on local area connection. Now in that box thingy, select 'Internet Protocol (TCP/IP)' and click properties. Now select 'Use the following DNS server addresses' For the primary DNS server put: 203.96.219.18 And for the seconadry, put your router address eg 192.168.0.1
Also, tell me your ip address and the domain you want so i can add the records. I will not add certain domains, eg Google, youtube, yahoo, Maybe not microsoft. Apple is definately not gonna be added....(unless you pay)
These domains can only be accessed by people with the DNS settings provided. This will also work with linux and vista, etc... just find your own way to the dns server settings.

item.title: Free Domains. Using a real DNS server
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Unid H4x0r:

It’s way easier to buy it.

Indeed, seeing as you (and the two other people using this) will be the only ones who are able to see it.

Read full topic

item.title: Free Domains. Using a real DNS server
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

this is sort of like Magmas DNS(this doesnt edit the hosts file), but it uses a real dns server.
So you will need to go to control panel (this is the windows xp way.) Have it in windows xp style, classic is just too many icons to explain.
Now click ‘Network and Internet Connections’ now go down the list and click ‘Network Connections’
Right click>properties on local area connection.
Now in that box thingy, select ‘Internet Protocol (TCP/IP)’ and click properties.
Now select ‘Use the following DNS server addresses’ For the primary DNS server put: 203.96.219.18
And for the seconadry, put your router address eg 192.168.0.1

Also, tell me your ip address and the domain you want so i can add the records.
I will not add certain domains, eg Google, youtube, yahoo, Maybe not microsoft. Apple is definately not gonna be added…(unless you pay)

These domains can only be accessed by people with the DNS settings provided.
This will also work with linux and vista, etc… just find your own way to the dns server settings.

Read full topic
